Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][WCAG2.1]Some of the contents of API Key page get overlapped when screen is zoom to 400%." (#8281) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1061307
‚Äã
Environment Details:
Application Name: NuGet Service
Application URL:https://www.nuget.org/
Windows Version - Windows10 
Edge Version-Microsoft Edge 44.18362.449.0
Chrome Version- Version 79.0.3945.130 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Pre-requisite:
Set the desktop size value to 1280 x 1024.

Note:
Same issue is observed in Upload packages page

Steps to Reproduce :
1.Launch application using provided URL.(https://www.nuget.org/)
2.Navigated to Home page
3.Click on ‚ÄúSign in‚Äù option (top right) and click on ‚ÄúSign in with Microsoft‚Äù button
4.Sign in using MSA on the common Microsoft sign-in page
5.Go to ‚ÄúAPI Keys‚Äù from the context menu (top left menu dropdown).
6.Navigate till "Create Control" and expand it.
7.Observe that some of the contents get overlapped when the screen is zoom to 400%.

Actual: 
When the screen is zoomed to 400%,  Some of the contents present on the screen get overlapped.
The below data shown in the screenshot gets overlapped after zooming the screen :
Image

Expected: 
When screen is zoomed to 400%, all the contents present on the screen should not get overlapped and should appear properly on the screen.

User Impact: 
Low vision users will find difficulty in viewing and reading the content present on the screen when zoomed to 400%.

Notes:
See this screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/96502433-a0188f80-1206-11eb-89ea-6097e412051e.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Cookies] Expire and set the domain of Google Analytics cookies" (#8263) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
- Expire Google Analytics cookies in a year;
- Set the domain as 'none', to avoid sharing Google Analytics cookies with the status page.
References:
https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/analyticsjs/cookies-user-id
https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/analyticsjs/field-reference#cookieDomain
https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/analyticsjs/field-reference#cookieExpires

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y][WCAG2.1]Two scroll bars appears on the screen after changing the display orientation to portrait" (#8282) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
"Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier."
‚Äã
Environment Details:
Application Name: NuGet Service
Application URL:https://www.nuget.org/
Windows Version - Windows10 
Edge Version-Microsoft Edge 44.18362.449.0
Chrome Version- Version 79.0.3945.130 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Pre-requisite:
Set the display orientation setting to "Portrait"
Start>Setting>System>Display Orientation.

Steps to Reproduce :
1.Launch application using provided URL.(https://www.nuget.org/)
2. Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Select ‚ÄúAPI Keys‚Äù from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
5. "API Keys" screen gets opened.
6. Observe that Two scroll bars appears on the screen after changing the display orientation to the portrait.

Actual:
Two scroll bars appear on the screen after changing the display orientation to the portrait.
Similar issue is also observed with the following screens:
API Keys-Create
Create-Select Packages
API Keys-Manage
Manage-Edit 
Upload Package
Manage Organizations
Manage Organizations-Add New
Manage Organizations -Organizations
Packages returned for json
.Json-InfoSection
.Json-OwnersSection
.Json-PackageReference
.Json-Paket CLI
.Json-Dependencies
.Json-GitHub Usage
.Json-Version History 
Expected:
Two scroll bars should not appear on the screen after changing the display orientation to the portrait.
 
User Impact: 
Users will find it difficult to view the data in a single layout .

Notes:
This is in reference to a horizontal scrollbar appearing:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/96502880-4a90b280-1207-11eb-86b9-8faa167b3708.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Write a blog about the engineering side of Azure Search migration" (#7551) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[A11y][UI]Ensures every id attribute value is unique (form)" (#8189) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1184527

On NuGetGallery | Manage Organization page
## Snippet
<form aria-hidden="true" id="AntiForgeryForm"> <input name="__RequestVerificationToken" type="hidden" value="..
## How to fix
Fix any of the following:
- Document has multiple static elements with the same id attribute: AntiForgeryForm

## Environment
Chrome version 84.0.4147.135 This accessibility issue was found using Accessibility Insights for Web 2.21.1 (axe-core 4.0.1), a tool that helps find and fix accessibility issues. Get more information & download this tool at http://aka.ms/AccessibilityInsights.

## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][ARIA]The purpose of the Learn more link is not descriptive" (#8184) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1184490
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450)


## Repro Steps:

    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "upload tab" item and press enter
    Tab till "Verify" drop down and press enter.
    Tab till "Learn more" link
    Check whether the purpose of the link is defined by the name of the link or not

## Actual Results:

The purpose of the link is not descriptive for the "Learn more" and "Read more" links

   
## Expected Results:
The purpose of the link should be more descriptive. Screen reader should understand it clearly
## User Impact:
Users with visual disabilities may find it difficult to understand the purpose of the link, if link name is not descriptive.

## Notes
Updating the aria-label in this case to a more descriptive text is sufficient. See https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7879 for a similar fix.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][ARIA]NVDA is not announcing the Status message displayed after selecting the create button without giving any glob pattern" (#8194) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188211
## Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Repro Steps:

    Turn on NVDA
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "API Keys" and Press enter
    Tab till "Create' Button and press enter to expand it
    Input all the fields except 'Glob pattern' 
    Tab till "Create button" and press enter
    Input all the fields except 'Glob pattern' 
    Verify whether the NVDA is reading the status message displayed or not

## Actual Results:

NVDA is not announcing the Status message displayed after selecting the create button without giving any glob pattern
## Expected Results:
Screen reader user should be able to know about the status message displayed after selecting create button without giving glob pattern. NVDA should announce immediately when it is displayed
## User Impact:
Screen reader users may not understand what is the issue occurred if the Screen reader is not announces the status message

## Notes
We will need a new aria-live region that will read this information out when it changes. This should be similar to the other aria-live regions we use for alerting.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Generating MSBuild Binary log from nuget restore command" (#10135) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
How can I generate MSBuild Binary log from nuget client commands like restore ? 

`nuget restore` resolves into something like `msbuild.exe "%temp%\NuGetScratch\ro0d0kct.z0t.nugetinputs.targets" /t:GenerateRestoreGraphFile /nologo /nr:false /v:q /p:NuGetRestoreTargets="%temp%\NuGetScratch\w3s4ivaf.f43.nugetrestore.targets" /p:RestoreUseCustomAfterTargets="True" /p:RestoreTaskAssemblyFile="<path to nuget.exe>" /p:RestoreSolutionDirectory="<path to sln directory>" /p:SolutionDir="<path to solution dir>" /p:SolutionNam=<solution name>`

How can I get it to pass `/bl` to msbuild so that a binary log is output at the end of nuget restore?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CPVM equivalent of GlobalPackageReference?" (#10159) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We're looking at migrating from https://github.com/microsoft/MSBuildSdks/tree/master/src/CentralPackageVersions to the built-in central package versioning feature, and (unless I missed it) I didn't see an equivalent of `GlobalPackageReference`.

I'm guessing that for all of our (many) build/analyzer packages, we can do the equivalent and manually add both `PackageVersion` and `PackageReference` (with IncludeAssets and PrivateAssets set as `GlobalPackageReference` does)? Is there any reason we shouldn't add the `PackageReference`s directly in Directory.Packages.props?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "unit test to compare lock file target libraries in project.assets.json file with Dependencies tree" (#9971) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: This issue has been created to develop a unit test to compare lock file target libraries in `project.assets.json` file with Dependencies tree. Inspired by [this](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3598#discussion_r475776278) code review comment.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Use LazyIntializer API to initialize a target type in a multi threaded environment" (#8738) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
In the current [implementation](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/c1f6915918b82c096bbd666bd9c18528f1f70630/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio/IDE/ExtensibleSourceRepositoryProvider.cs#L54) object is always locked even-though target type is already initialized.  Learnt from this [doc](https://github.com/microsoft/referencesource/blob/17b97365645da62cf8a49444d979f94a59bbb155/mscorlib/system/threading/LazyInitializer.cs#L197) that there is a .NET framework implementation to accomplish the same logic. `This issue is created to track other lazy initializations which rely on a similar pattern`.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Pushing multiple packages in CI is causing a file lock, failing 2nd push" (#10158) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
When using CI (GitHub Actions and `dotnet nuget push` with *.nupkg, the files are found and a first package is pushed, but then the second fails.

Example: https://github.com/timheuer/strava-net/runs/1243834288#step:7:19

```
Pushing strava-net.1.0.0.symbols.nupkg to '/home/runner/work/strava-net/strava-net/published/'...
Your package was pushed.
Pushing strava-net.1.0.0.nupkg to '/home/runner/work/strava-net/strava-net/published/'...
error: The process cannot access the file '/home/runner/work/strava-net/strava-net/published/strava-net.1.0.0.nupkg' because it is being used by another process.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Cannot use relative URLs in dotnet push" (#10157) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
I‚Äôm trying to use `dotnet nuget push` with *.nupkg and 1) the docs are wrong (I submitted a bug) 2) the source parameter seems to require a fully-qualified source and cannot use relative roots?
 
I‚Äôm doing this in CI and am trying to basically use ‚Äú.‚Äù As the source directory but looks like the CLI treats this as too literally and doesn‚Äôt like that.

From conversation it appears it could be 
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/65abcc61f73ab3d87928495f789ec74011edde7f/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Commands/Utility/PackageSourceProviderExtensions.cs#L47
Versus using `RelativeOrAbsolute`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Spec for PMUI Tab-Switch Refactoring" (#10156) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Should Refresh button apply to all tabs?" (#10155) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
My concern was, if I click Refresh, do I expect the entire UI to have fresh data no matter which tab I look at? 

Related work: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10147

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Spec for PMUI Tab-Switch Refactoring" (#10154) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@donnie-msft commented on [Wed Oct 14 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/pull/588)



---

@donnie-msft commented on [Thu Oct 15 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/pull/588#issuecomment-709643096)

> Thanks for the great write-up @donnie-msft 
> 
> Something that I was not able to find (or missed), when you open the PM UI and it ends up on the default tab, does the browse tab start loading? I assume the answer is no. 
> 
> How about the reverse? On the browse, does the installed tab equivalent data start loading? 
> I know that we do look at the existing installed packages in order to populate the number in the updates tab label, and I think this is one reason why initial PM UI loading feels heavy to users with machines that are not really powerful.

This spec has no effect on the existing behavior of automatically loading whichever tab is open when the window is first opened.

We always load the tab header counts, and perhaps could be more conservative with that. Do you feel it fits with this work or a future spec?

---

@nkolev92 commented on [Thu Oct 15 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/pull/588#issuecomment-709646231)

> This spec has no effect on the existing behavior of automatically loading whichever tab is open when the window is first opened.

Oh I didn't mean to suggest that. We read a setting currently and we default to that, I think that's great.

> We always load the tab header counts, and perhaps could be more conservative with that. Do you feel it fits with this work or a future spec?

I think it's ok for that to be a part of a future work item. 
Doesn't the tab header count update require fetching of all packages for that project/solution & checking whether they have any updates?

---

@donnie-msft commented on [Thu Oct 15 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/pull/588#issuecomment-709707000)

> Doesn't the tab header count update require fetching of all packages for that project/solution & checking whether they have any updates?

Yes, and Deprecation info!
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Xamls/PackageManagerControl.xaml.cs#L947-L950

---

@nkolev92 commented on [Fri Oct 16 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/pull/588#issuecomment-710624742)

> Yes, and Deprecation info!
> https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Xamls/PackageManagerControl.xaml.cs#L947-L950

Yuck :D 
So say you open the browse tab...wait for 20s, then open the installed tab, does it now get loaded quicker than just loading the installed tab directly? 
Basically, are we reusing the work that we did for figuring out the label count?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Triage PM UI issues for Quality Month" (#10153) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Come up with a plan for Quality Month

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Port Package Source Telemetry to ETW instead of .NET events" (#10152) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Following our internal discussion about using ETW & design patterns for  NuGet product monitoring vs telemetry, this task should:

1. Complete investigations on how to use the appropriate APIs effectively
2. Change our Package Source Diagnostics from using .NET events to use ETW instead, and change the VS telemetry to listen to those ETW events instead of the .NET events
3. Show an example of capturing those events in PerfView

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Finish support of Images for codespaces - remote stream from service" (#10151) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When running against a codespace, need to remote images from:
1) embedded images in packages
2) local feeds
3) http feeds that the client cannot get to (???)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Very large retry count for GraphOperations to try resolving dependency conflicts" (#4715) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
There is some 1000 times retries logic in GraphOperations class to try n resolve dependency conflicts. We need to reevaluate this logic and such a high count of retries since it calls into lot of nested foreach loops so at times, it becomes really expensive and allocates bunch of memory.

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.DependencyResolver.Core/GraphModel/GraphOperations.cs#L181

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Loading Status Indicator refactoring for new tab lists paradigm" (#10150) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The Loading Status indicator was tied directly to the InfiniteScrollList, which now has 2 ListBoxes to improve perf.

I need to create 2 independent indicators to go along with that. I'm refactoring this code a bit to pull it away from the InfiniteScrollList, and reduce the dependency there.
